Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is a high-efficiency power generation system that is a large fuel option and converts chemical energy directly into electrical energy.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: In this study, the parameters affecting the performance of a cathode and an electrolyte supported SOFC are numerically investigated by developing a finite element method (FEM) based SOFC model involving conservation of mass, momentum, species and energy with ionic and electronic charge transfer.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: After the validation of the mathematical model, effects of support thickness, oxidant type, operating temperature and pressure on the performance of the cells are examined by using a FEM code Comsol.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: These effects of parameters are shown by the polarization and power curves.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: As a result of the study, it can be concluded that the performance of the SOFC increases with increasing the operating temperature and pressure values.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: Compared with the electrolyte-supported, the cathode-supported SOFC is shown to exhibit higher performance in terms of support thickness and operating parameters.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: The effect of support thickness is seen that the cell power is inversely proportional to the support layer thickness.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: The improved performance thus the higher hydrogen consumption can be attributed to the lack of N-2 and higher reaction rate when the pure oxygen is used as oxidant.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model

Sentencas: In general it can be said that the cathode-supported SOFC always outperforms the electrolyte-supported SOFC.
Titulo: Numerical modelling of a cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) in comparison with an electrolyte-supported model
